name: World of Zoo
description: What would you do if you had the keys to the zoo? World of Zoo is the only life sim game that pushes you past the fences and into a world of your own zoo. Create and customize your zoo experience and develop hands on relationships to earn the trust and love of your animals.
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft Windows XP/Vista Processor: Intel Pentium IV processor running at 2 GHz, AMD 64, Core 2 duo 1.6Ghz  or equivalent  Memory: 512 MB RAM (1 GB RAM on Vista) Graphics: Nvidia GeForce 6600 GT or ATI Radeon x1600 with at least 64MB of memory (video cards with Pixel Shader version 1.1 or better are required) Display: DirectX-compatible display capable of 800x600 resolution in 16-bit color DirectX®: DirectX 9.0c and above Hard Drive: 2GB of hard drive space Sound: Sound: 16-bit Sound Blaster Compatible

reviews.review_text: Only played this a little while, but damn it's cute!  Reminds me of kinectimals, and nintendogs on my 3DS. But with a lot more variety...and probably more stuff to do.  Started with the big cats (can't think why :P ) and now have a little cub in the exhibit too. Hehe, too damn cute.  Graphics are cute too, and the animals move quite well and realistically. They behave as you'd expect, when stroking and brushing, and even have a little fun without you pestering them all the time. Just give em a toy, and watch em go...or sit back and let them make their own fun.  I especially like the thought bubbles...makes it easier to do stuff with them, without having to search for ages in your bag to find what they wanted.

It's got all the animals and all the poop you would ever want to pick up. Great for furries and people who like to work as a janitor, because your animals literally get covered in ♥♥♥♥ the second you stop watching.
The best game ever. 10/10. Better than MGS 4.
I have no idea why this is on my game's list.
